_header: When nothing was but God alone
Note: The first three lines, and first and third lines of burden, duplicate 6385.
_description:
On the Power of God’s Word — nine 3-line stanzas (aaa) and burden: ‘Why why what ys this why / Hit ys non nodyre sekurely / But werttus wereby
domini’

NLWPork10.First Lines:
Whane noþing whas but God aloneThe Fadyre the Holly Gost and
                    the SoneWhon ys iii and iii us Whon…
NLWPork10.Last Lines:
…God hymselfe byddyt vs by his senttensTo lovfe owre reson and
                    owre efydensAnd to his wordys yef wholl credens
NLWPork10.Editions:
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 229-30; 1977, 204.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 187-8.
